title: Kidney disease impairs tendon function in rats.
abstract: Spontaneous tendon rupture occurs in a concerning number of individuals with chronic kidney disease (CKD); however almost no data exist regarding CKD-related tendon pathology. Given that tendon ruptures have a significant impact on health and well-being we sought to determine whether tendon mechanics are altered by kidney disease in an established rat model of CKD.
